data.title: Yingluck next for return?
data.description: The release on parole of former commerce minister Boonsong Teriyapirom, who was convicted of corruption in the rice-pledging scheme, has heightened speculation about a possible return of fugitive former prime minister Yingluck Shinawatra.

data.title: Thailand's biggest call scam centre boss arrested near Cambodia
data.description: Police on Monday arrested a Chinese man suspected of heading Thailand

data.title: Thailand, Malaysia brace for fresh wave of floods as water levels ease
data.description: KUALA LUMPUR/BANGKOK -  Malaysia  and  Thailand  are facing a second wave of heavy rain and  potential flooding  this week, authorities said on Monday, even as some displaced residents were able to return home and the worst floods in decades began receding in some areas.

data.title: Thai prawn soup whets Unesco lips
data.description: Tom Yum Kung prawn soup  is expected to be listed by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation ( Unesco ) as one of Thailandâ€™s  tangible cultural heritage , according to Culture Minister Sudawan Wangsuphakijkosol.

data.title: Klong Toey's Lao Market in Bangkok demolished for bus stop
data.description: The  Lao Market  in Klong Toey district of Bangkok is being  demolished  to broaden the pavement and install a bus stop, according to the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA).

data.title: BMA tears down Klong Toey's Lao Market
data.description: The Lao Market in Klong Toey district of Bangkok is being demolished to broaden the pavement and install a bus stop, according to the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA).

data.title: King to review troops at Dusit Palace
data.description: His Majesty the King will on Tuesday inspect the Trooping the Colour which will be led by Her Majesty the Queen and joined by Her Royal Highness Princess Sirivannavari Nariratana Rajakanya, according to an announcement in the Royal Gazette.

data.title: Govt: Myanmar's attack on unarmed Thai fishing boats was 'overreaction'
data.description: The Thai government has insisted that the Myanmar military opening fire at Thai fishing boats in the Andaman Sea on Saturday was an "overreaction" and repeated its demand for the immediate return of the four detained Thai crewmembers.

data.title: Thaioil has backup plan to end Clean Fuel Project delays
data.description: Thaioil Plc is prepared to exercise its rights under a parent guarantee agreement with the main contractors of the US$5.37 billion Clean Fuel Project (CFP) to resolve persistent project delays.

data.title: Govt: Myanmar's attack on Thai fishing boats was 'overreaction', demands return of crew
data.description: The Thai government has insisted that the Myanmar military opening fire at Thai fishing boats in the Andaman Sea on Saturday was an "overreaction" and repeated its demand for the immediate return of the four detained Thai crewmembers.

data.title: Illegal internet cables found installed across Thai-Myanmar bridge
data.description: TAK - Large  internet cables  have been found  illegally installed  across the  Thai-Myanmar Friendship Bridge  and were being used by  call centre  gangs.

data.title: Flood victims in Southern Thailand to get cash aid
data.description: Deputy Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said the government intends to compensate every household affected by flooding in the South with 9,000 baht in a similar fashion to payouts made to those recently affected by floods in the North.

data.title: Jailed, corrupt former commerce minister released on parole
data.description: The Department of Corrections on Monday released on parole former commerce minister Boonsong Teriyapirom, who was earlier sentenced to 48 years in prison for corruption in government rice sales, according to an informed source.

data.title: Guest caught on camera stealing hotel's money
data.description: PATTAYA - A foreign guest was filmed stealing 4,000 baht from the untended front desk of an apartment hotel while checking out early on Sunday morning.

data.title: Rama II Road fix in 2 weeks
data.description: The outbound lanes on Rama II Road in Samut Sakhon will be re-opened to traffic within 14 days after work to clear the site of Friday

data.title: Bhumjaithai backs sea dispute debate
data.description: The Bhumjaithai Party is supporting Pheu Thai list MP Noppadon Pattama

data.title: Institute hails progress in child heart procedures
data.description: About 4,000 babies are born with congenital heart disease each year, with 10% having severe heart disease needing urgent treatment, says the Department of Medical Services (DMS).

data.title: HIV forum urges more PrEP options
data.description: PrEP medication options for HIV prevention should be diversified to ensure people have more choices to meet their requirements, a recent forum as told.

data.title: Flood victims to get cash aid
data.description: Deputy Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul said the government intends to compensate every household affected by flooding in the South with 9,000 baht in a similar fashion to payouts made to those recently affected by floods in the North.

data.title: Solar key to PAT 'green ports' push
data.description: The Port Authority of Thailand (PAT) has introduced solar rooftops at its ports in a bid to establish "green ports". The rooftops are expected to produce five million kilowatt-hours of solar energy annually.

data.title: Informal talks to seek Asean five-point consensus
data.description: Vientiane: The next extended informal consultation on the  Myanmar  crisis in Bangkok this month can help support the five-point consensus on Myanmar proposed by the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (Asean), a senior Lao official said.

data.title: Bhumjaithai backs sea dispute debate
data.description: The Bhumjaithai Party is supporting Pheu Thai list MP Noppadon Pattama

data.title: Feeding energy-hungry AI tech advances
data.description: The growing popularity of  artificial intelligence  (AI) technology as a powerful new tool is raising questions of how the world can supply sufficient energy to resource-hungry  AI  while countries are shifting to clean energy.
